snippet: Twenty-eight legends of the Downtown scene — including Philip Glass, Larry Kramer, Chuck Close and Iman — gather in SoHo for a special portrait.
abstract: Group photo of notable artists, writers, performers, musicians and intellectuals who defined New York City's cultural scene in late 1970s and early 80s, with mention of those who have died from AIDS.

byline.contributor: Artwork in photo: Niele Toroni, ‘‘25 paintings,’’ 1987, orange acrylic on canvas, 25 canvases, each 39 ¼ x 39 ¼ in. Production: Pony Productions

lead_paragraph: Twenty-eight legends of the Downtown scene — including Philip Glass, Larry Kramer, Chuck Close and Iman — gather in SoHo for a special portrait.
